inn1.comm: swing straightaway. This one curls back in, it's fuller in length and hits Masakadza outside leg as he looks to flick. A stifled appeal, but that was just being overly optimistic
back of length delivery on middle, pushed to short cover
lands it full and on middle, the ball swings back in a touch as Masakadza turns it to mid-on. Hands in the air for Sran on his followthrough
once again looks to work it across the line, is hit high on the thigh pad. Sran is working up decent pace, that was in the mid-130s again
banana swing back in again from middle, prodigious swing, I must say. Masakadza prods outside the line and is hit on the thigh pad
floats it full on off stump, Masakadza gets half-forward to bunt the inswinging delivery back down the pitch. Excellent first over from Sran
some away movement from the back of length area outside off, he watches it through to Dhoni. Not much carry on that occasion
stands tall and punches the short of length delivery on off stump to cover
solidly behind the line of that away swinger, punched back to the bowler

lovely flick of the wrists, balance and timing near-perfect as he gets off the mark with a boundary. The ball was shaping away, but it was starting around leg stump. That gave him the confidence to control that flick as he played it wide of a diving Chahal at mid-on

back of length delivery outside off, left alone. On the second bounce to Dhoni. Mind you, this is a different surface to the one used on Saturday. Worth having the slip fielders two steps in, perhaps?
play and a miss. Looks to force it off the backfoot, but is late on the shot
hustles him for pace with that short ball on leg stump, Masakadza is clearly beaten for pace as he shapes to pull, gloves it down to fine leg. Not entirely convincing
turns it wide of midwicket and scampers through for a single
slides this one down leg side, he fails to get a faint tickle past Dhoni
angles it full outside off in search of some swing, this one holds its line instead, left alone
once again a full-length delivery on the sixth stump, this one nips back in a touch. It was just flirting with the wide line, legal delivery
drives, but gets a thick inside edge that bisects midwicket and mid-on, two it will be since it wasn't timed all that well. Tumbling stop from Rayudu
stays inside the crease and covers the line to defend that incoming length ball

flicks, but it got more elevation than distance.The ball was miles in the air, but just plonked outside the 30-yard circle at midwicket. It wasn't all that full for him to play the stroke. Lucky on that occasion
perhaps jags away after hitting a crack outside off, Dhoni dives to his right to collect that

that's thumped off the frontfoot. He was totally committed when he made contact. It wasn't all that bad a delivery, but the authority in Masakadza's foot work was unmistakable as he presented the full face of the bat as he made contact
lets the away-swinger through to the wicketkeeper
looks to flick, but the ball curls away as Masakadza ends up slicing it between cover and point. He closed the bat face very early
nips away off the deck outside off, he wanted to play but watches it through to Dhoni in the end
angles it across the batsman, this one holds its line, left alone
deflects off the thigh pad to square leg. He looked to whip that off his hip but was late on the shot

as far as catches go, it can't get simpler than that. It was a delicious half-volley outside off, Masakadza's eyes lit up and he threw his bat at that, but didn't transfer any weight whatsoever forward, as the thick edge flew to Bumrah who took a regulation catch at third man. He perhaps played for some inswing when there was none. Sran looks up to the skies to thank the gods. First one in the bag for him today
searches for some swing by bowling it full on middle, turned to midwicket this time
gets on top of the bounce to cut, gets a thick edge towards third man where Bumrah does well to move to his left to stop that
hustles him for pace with a back of length delivery on off, gets an inside edge back to the bowler
how did that miss the stumps? This one pitched outside off and went straight on. Moor expected it to swing back in and pushed outside the line
full and swinging away from outside off, excellent shape, left alone
short, and enough width on offer, but all Moor does is watch it through to Dhoni. Perhaps a scoring opportunity missed
covers the swing nicely as he bunts that length ball to short cover
peach! Moor is drawn forward but the ball swung away late to whiz past the outside edge
gets on top of the bounce and taps it to the cover fielder. Steady over
third man into play again, went for a cut but found a thick edge through to Bumrah. He was cramped for room on that occasion

indecision in footwork has consumed him. Moor hopped back when he could have well prodded forward, and ends up getting into a tangle as the ball nips back in to hit him in front of middle. He pushed outside the line of the delivery too. Sran's morning just got better
curls back in to hit the pad, but the impact was outside leg, they steal a leg-bye
crunching sound of bat hitting ball as he drove that off the frontfoot. Straight to mid-off though
hops back and tucks it to Chahal at midwicket
solidly behind the line of the ball as he punches it back to the bowler
gets across the stumps and works it wide of midwicket
nice high elbow as he stayed back inside the crease to punch that between cover and point, wasn't timed all that well though
chases a length ball moving away, ends up slicing it to third man. Not much foot work again as he went at that ball
pierces the packed off side ring this time. Once again it's a touch short, enough time for the batsman to open the face and ease that to Axar's left at backward point
an away-swinger at 129.9 clicks, he was starting from outside off, Sibanda lets it go
gets half-forward and opens the face of the bat to ease that with the swing to point
crunching cut shot, but a heavy outfield means the ball just stops near the boundary. Kedar Jadhav sprints towards the ropes to hurl the throw back in. This was hit to Axar Patel's right
gets half-forward and bunts it to the off side
looks to whip that over midwicket, but pushes outside the line of the inswinger again. Didn't get on top of the bounce either, and is hit on the thigh pad instead
looks to drive a length ball angling away, but quickly realises the risk and withdraws. Too late, the ball rolls off the bottom of the blade to third man
flicked with the angle, waited for it to come back in and eased it wide of midwicket for an easy single. Not much foot work. He's happy to play from inside the crease at the moment
prodigious movement back in again to hit him on the pad, well outside leg, as they steal a leg-bye
there's an open invitation to drive as the ball swings away from outside off, left alone

pulled across the line, but doesn't get hold of it. Still finds the gap at midwicket. The ball kept a touch low on that occasion, which meant he didn't hit it off the middle. Right intention though from Justice
shot of the morning. But he couldn't stay still for the pose and had to hare down the pitch to complete two runs. Played it late to pick the gap between cover and point. Lovely backfoot punch
a touch wide outside off again, mistimes the cut to point. Tried to hit it too hard on that occasion
once again a scoring opportunity missed. There was width on offer, but he went hard at it, and hit it straight to Axar at point

the bluff, or was it unintended? Two deliveries that moved away, this one comes back in from the off stump. Chibhabha is caught on the crease and by surprise as the ball thuds into his pad as he looks to awkwardly work it across the line. The umpire had no doubt whatsoever. That would have crashed into the stumps.
gets forward and squeezes the full ball outside off to point
play and a miss. Once again indecisive as he pokes at a ball that slants across him

he's crunched the pull. It was bowled in the mid-130s, the key to the pull was to pick the length early, which he did to pick the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Transferred the weight back to hit it with a horizontal bat. Excellent shot!
lovely, lovely drive, but straight to mid-off. Plants his foot forward to ease the half-volley. Everything right, except he couldn't pick the gap
watches a back of length delivery outside off through to MSD
cuts and misses. That was a genuine gift begging to be hit. He swung a touch early
squared up as the length ball nips away from off stump, the edge rolls to the off side
could have played the cut, but Raza decides to rock back and play a wristy whip wide of midwicket. Was a little too wide outside off for him to fetch it from there and still get the timing right
beauty! This one jags away off the seam from outside off, Sibanda was drawn forward and simply had to play at that one
this time he watchfully taps the back of length ball on off stump to cover point. The swing was well covered
brings the ball back in from wide of the crease, Sibanda picks that early as he defends it with a straight bat
too straight and he's flicked that uppishly into the gap at deep midwicket. Didn't come off the middle though as Sran has enough time to run around from deep square leg
starts off with short ball outside off from wide of the crease, watched through to Dhoni. Not much movement there
floats it on middle from an angle again, Raza is half-forward as he defends with a dead bat
hustles the batsman with a length ball that angles back in, tapped to the on side
this one nips back in off the seam from outside off, bowls it a lot fuller to invite the batsman to drive, Raza is happy to let that go
errs in line, overcompensates in his quest to get the batsman thinking. The inswing starts on middle and moves further down, Dhoni does well to dive to his left to stop that
beaten by the one that straightens this time. Raza is foxed as he plays for the one that nips back in. Except this pitches on length outside off and holds its line
gets half-forward and taps it to the off side
drifts one into middle and off, dabbed wide of cover for a quick single
tossed up on middle, not much turn on this one, Raza whips it wide of midwicket
gets forward and defends the incoming delivery to the leg side
the arm-ball this time, a lot fuller. He should have played forward, but is lucky to somehow manage to get his bat down on time and bunt it to cover for a single
beats the batsman as he shapes to cut. The ball fizzes off the deck outside off again, regulation take by Dhoni
ball hurries onto him again as he defends it to the off side
angles a length ball into middle and leg, and he's whipped that over the infield. Strong wrists into play there to get the elevation. Wrong line and punished
this time he bowls it outside off, Sibanda opens the bat face late to angle it down to a square third man, called for two immediately and his partner responded
bangs that one in short, but gets the radar wrong as it flies over the batsman's head. The line of attack was good, but a little too short for a surface with spongy bounce

beautiful, simply beautiful! Too short, but this one was sitting up nicely. It still needed the batsman to stand tall and punch that off the backfoot, which Sibanda did superbly. Transferred the weight back as he went through with the stroke.
attempts a similar stroke this time, but the ball moves away just a wee bit, beaten!

beaten by a peach. This one angled in from wide of the crease and then nipped away late. Sibanda was squared up as he played inside the line. The length created the doubt in his mind. He played for the one that comes back in
another peach! Hangs his bat out with an opened face, there's not much footwork on that either. He's lucky not to get a faint nick on that
drops it to the off side with soft hands for a quick single
drifts one back into middle from wide of the crease, defended to cover
arm ball that comes back in, whipped to long-on
fetches it from outside off and works it wide of the bowler, towards long-on
slow turn away from middle, bunted to cover
gets half-forward and defends. This one was fired in, perhaps for the first time today
quick and angling in from back of length, lbw appeal as Raza is hit in front of middle but pretty high on the back foot
oh beauty! Even shorter and angling in, Raza goes on his toes to defend outside off but the ball doesn't come in as much as he expects and is beaten
leading edge this time as Raza is troubled on the back foot again, but the ball falls short and wide of backward point
beaten outside off again! Short of length with the angle, Raza stays back and pokes and misses
this time he gets some bat on it. From wide of the crease and outside off, Raza went on his toes and defended just outside off
angling in bit too much towards the stumps, Raza works it off his pads towards midwicket for two
some loop towards middle stump, Sibanda leans forward and defends
slower through the air on middle and leg, Raza waits on the back foot and works it off the pad for one
outside off now with some turn, he waits and cuts it late, and it's stopped by a diving backward point
pitched up and that's launched over long-on for the first six of the match! Bit too full, Sibanda got under that nicely and showed the full face of the bat to clear the fielder in the deep
outside off now, he cuts it square and gets two to end the over
well outside off this time, Raza lets it go
angling in sharply from wide of the crease, Raza falls over a bit and drives it to mid-on
seams it in from back of length and outside off, Raza stays in the crease and defends it towards point
gets some room outside off and he punches it off the back foot for a four that will give him some confidence! Too short as well and he pounced on it
much better from Bumrah - just short of length and not much room, Raza shuffles a bit to off and defends it square
shuffles outside off again, just a bit, and lets this one go not far from the off stump. Good leave, though as there's good bounce too
flattish on middle stump, that keeps pretty low as Sibanda goes back and does well to defend it
slog-sweeps it in the air, there's a fielder at deep square leg but Sibanda evades him a bit. Kedar Jadhav does very well to run to his left and keep the ball in
Sibanda leans forward and defends the googly to leg. No-ball for overstepping
that was almost a medium-pacer bowling at 109kph well outside off, he pushed it down to long-off for one
towards the leg stump and it's swept to leg for one
just a bit of too outside off and he goes back to cut it square for one more
nicely flighted on off stump, Sibanda leans forward and blocks
length delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
touch shorter and it's punched to extra cover
much straighter and it's pushed back to the bowler
gets some room this time and he cuts it nicely to beat point and gets two to bring up the fifty stand
angles it in from wide of the crease, he defends it back
outside off now, Raza cuts it late but can't beat backward point
bit of flight on leg stump, it's defended to leg
flatter and shorter on middle and leg, he goes back to swat it to leg but finds midwicket
outside off now with some turn, he steers it with the turn to point
bit too short and he rocks back to pull that over the midwicket fielder to find the gap for four!
leans forward this time to push it to off with the spin
bit too short and wide, and turning away too, cuts it nicely to sweeper cover
pitched up and what a drive Sibanda has unleashed! Went down on a knee in no time and drilled that along the ground and through the covers for a cracking four!
outside off again, pushed to covers this time
presses forward to block the length delivery to off now
much straighter and it's driven down to long-off
touch shorter on off, he waits and helps it to short third man
fuller on the pads, Raza can't flick it away, he defends it towards square leg
hint of turn for the ball on middle, he defends it to off
lots of flight for the full delivery outside off, he chips it down to long-off
shuffles down the track and takes it on the pad as there's no room
comes down again and no room again, but gets some bat this time
shorter and wider, there's turn too and he chops it nicely to deep backward point
shorter, flatter and closer to off, Sibanda still punches it to deep cover to keep strike
angling in towards off, blocked on the off side
much slower and a tad shorter, blocked on the off side again
length delivery towards off, he defends it towards point
and what a way to bring up the fifty! Shorter ball, he rocks back to pull that to the wide long-on boundary for a four and Ntini stands up to show the batsman his thumbs up!
bit of forward lean and defended to off
leans forward and blocks the length ball to off
bit of flight on middle, Raza defends it back

he tries to break the shackles but he's holed out to long-on! It was pitched up around off, Raza went across the line and tried to clear the fielder in the deep but found him pretty comfortably. Kedar Jadhav it was

oh, he's gone first ball, Chahal has him lbw! It looked very close and umpire Langton Rusere gave it out confidently. Looks like the flighted ball pitched on leg and turned just enough to come back towards the stumps as Chigumbura came forward to defend but missed. Replays show it pitched on leg and would have hit middle and leg. So all good with the decision
a pretty dead-bat defence as the ball is flighted outside off and it's blocked
pushed into the covers with the turn
bit of forward lean and it's pushed into the covers again
presses forward and blocks the length delivery
defends this one late towards point
blocks this one off the front foot to off
bit of forward lean and it's blocked again outside off
a bit short and he pulls it awkwardly to long-on
headed towards the stumps and Mutumbami blocks by covering the stumps
some turn around off and it's pushed to off
lets this one go outside off
touch closer to off and it's driven to extra cover

oh my, Sibanda has given it away. There go Zimbabwe's hopes! It was a length delivery well outside off and Sibanda went ahead with a big slog-sweep, but the ball turned a fair bit and took a leading edge that went really high. Enough time for Jadhav to come forward and to his left for an easy catch
tossed up on off, blocked back to the bowler
adjusts late to steer the ball from outside off to backward point
slightly full and it's pushed down to long-off for one
shorter and bit outside off, defends it square to point
on the pads now and Mutumbami helps it to deep square leg easily
angling in from outside off, inside edge onto the pad
from the middle of the bat now as he pushes the ball into the covers
finds extra cover again, with a more confident drive this time
back of length and straight around off, he defends it back
slightly towards middle and leg now, similar length, and it's defended to leg
the ball holds its line a bit after pitching on off, short of length again, and it's defended again
pretty straight and it's defended off the back foot
errs with the line a bit, on the pads and it's flicked to deep square leg for one
just short of length on the pads again, deflected off the pad behind square and they settle for one
some room outside off and Cremer drives it late to beat point for one

inside edge as the ball nips in sharply and the finger goes up! Short delivery that pitched well outside off and jagged in sharply off the pitch to get a faint inside edge and Dhoni did the rest by going to his left. Mutumbami shakes his head, but replays show there was something the ball touched on its way. Looks like bat unless more replays suggest otherwise
beats him completely! Similar short delivery, touch closer to the stumps, and Chatara's bat came down about an hour later as the ball went just over the off stump
much fuller and this time Chatara drives firmly through the covers for two
length delivery outside off, bat comes down on time to defend it
ends the over with a bouncer and Chatara ducks under it
some tennis ball bounce outside off, goes off the top part of the bat in the air towards mid-off but falls well short
more towards leg now and it's tucked behind square for one
watches the length outside off, it goes straight and he shoulders arms

that one pitched outside off, this one on off and then knocks it over! Nice seam position of the ball as it was back of length and held its line, making Chatara wanting to flick it to leg but the movement beat him and struck top of off
nicely delivered outside off with some out swing and he's beaten
outside off again and Muzarabani defends it this time
that's some sharp angle Bumrah is using to bring the ball in. Short ball and Cremer just about defends it into the covers
no bat this time as it jags in sharply and gets Cremer's pads
errs down the leg side this time for a wide
much straighter on off stump now, Cremer defends it back to Bumrah
length ball now, and coming in sharply, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket for one
he's driven that like Chatara and gets four! Some room outside off, it was a length delivery and he swung his arms without any footwork, connecting well to drive that through the covers
closer to the off stump now, Muzarabani defends with firm hands
pretty straight on middle stump, steered to the leg side for one
shuffles down to drive that to mid-on and takes a quick single. Bit of a fumble from Sran at mid-on
a misfield at cover now after the length delivery was driven by Cremer. Rayudu concedes a single
bangs in the short ball around off, Muzarabani sways his head out of the line and ducks to let it go
lovely outswing for the length delivery outside off, it moves away and he lets it go
touch shorter and nice outswing again, Muzarabani looked to play this one but let it go in the end
that's gone well down leg for a wide. "Na, na na, na," says Dhoni
drives it down but gets en inner edge to short fine leg for a single
slightly short outside off, he waits and guides it to point

more flight and using the angle to aim for the stumps, loud appeal and Gould gives it out after a couple of seconds! It was like a flighted slider as Muzarabani went forward to defend and was struck right in front

inn2.comm: starts off with a full awayswinger that lands just a touch outside off, Rahul lets that go
looks to punch that past cover, but the ball hits a crack and keeps low. An appeal from the bowler, but no support from his mates
eases the half-volley to mid-off, covered the swing and got the feet fully forward as he made contact
another delivery that keeps low outside off, Rahul dabs it to the off side

cuts and misses. This time, he looks to smash the cover of the ball. There was the width, but his head wasn't on top of the delivery entirely. He was looking towards point instead of looking down on the ball when he went at it
gets half-forward and bunts it to the off side. Maiden first up for India, Zimbabwe with the same now
back of length delivery outside off, eased behind point for a quick single, Nair off the mark

bad ball, and punished. Too short, and there's width. This time, Rahul is onto the back foot in a jiffy as he crunches that between cover and point. Long chase for Raza, who does well to pull it back in just as momentum threatened to take him over
too full and straight on middle and leg, nudged wide of midwicket for another quick single
hops onto the back foot and punches it to cover

sweet sound, very sweet. Buffet bowling this. He'll pick those away for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Too short, and it was sitting up nicely to give it a good old thwack in front of point. Tracer bullet stuff on this slow outfield
straying onto the pads, turned to midwicket
gets some lift off the deck from the length area on off stump, Nair loosens the grip on his bottom hand as he dabs that to the off side
reaches out to cut, but that was far too wide, gets the bottom of the bat there as it rolls to the off side. He didn't need to play that really
watches the away-swinger through to the keeper, it was bowled well outside off
solidly behind the line, leans forward and covers the swing by offering a dead bat

imperious! Picks the length early, transfers the weight onto the backfoot and fetches the pull from outside off. Gets enough bat on it as it speeds away into the midwicket boundary. He was always trying to hit that all along the ground
back of length delivery moving away from outside off, left alone
glorious drive off the frontfoot, but straight to Raza at cover

beautiful straight drive, Tendulkar would have been proud of that. Leans forward, throws his body weight forward as he makes contact with a high elbow and a dead straught bat. The ball bounces over the stumps at the non-striker's end as it races away into the boundary
crunching cut shot, but straight to point. Lucky to get away with that
he's looking in glorious touch here. A half-volley that is crunched to cover, where Raza comes into play again. Moved swiftly to his left before dishing in a dive to stop that firm drive
angles a length ball into middle and leg, turned to square leg
lovely off-drive, but hit straight to mid-off
hits the deck hard and gets some lift off the length area on off stump, Nair gets on top of the bounce and defends
delightful! Stands tall and punches that off the backfoot into the cover point boundary. Generated tremendous power as he made contact. The ball pinged the dead centre of his bat
gets onto the backfoot and taps the short ball back down the pitch with soft hands
too full and well outside off, Nair lets it go. Harsh call, perhaps? Was 50-50

how lucky is Nair?  It was a poor shot for starters. This wasn't all that short to cut but he went through, the ball nipped away ever-so-slightly as well to take a thick edge through to the keeper. He was dejected and started to walk back when he was asked to stop. Clearly the bowler over-stepped. There was nothing behind the line. Now for him to make use of the reprieve! Free-hit coming up

he's clobbered that down the ground. Perfect release shot. That should get him going. Length ball with enough width outside off, Nair walks a couple of paces down the pitch and flat-bats that over the bowler's head, one bounce into the boundary
works it wide of midwicket for an easy single
stays inside the crease to negotiate that full ball on off stump gently
full-blooded straight drive, bowler stops it with his boot on the follow-through
wrists the incoming length ball on middle to midwicket
delightful on-drive, but an outstanding effort to stop that at mid-on
excellent delivery, that's more like it. Angles a delivery just a touch ahead of good length outside off, holds its line as well, good leave by Nair
cuts, but not off the middle. That one bounced to point off the bottom half. Width, yes but he went really hard at it
the length ball jags away a touch from outside off, left alone
gentle dab off the back foot towards the man coming in from point, quick eye contact and they were off for the run. Not needed really even though both of them are quick between the wickets

nearly a grave mistake. Nair is generally watchful outside the off stump, but this time has another poke at it. Wanted to pull out just as he realised it was a mistake, but was too late. The swing ensured there was no edge there. He's riding luck here
gets behind the line and defends the length ball on middle back down the pitch
comes back in from outside off, Nair shoulders arms. On that occasion, he seemed dead sure as to where the off stump was
there's some grip this time, it was the off cutter, Nair stretches forward and then takes the bottom hand off as he defends
full ball on middle that curls away a touch, Nair works it across the line to mid-on
not quite in the slot for Rahul to drive, he still does and mistimes it to mid-off

you beauty! Half-volley and he takes full toll of it this time. Comes down on the ball with all the power in the world. He was in total control of that cover drive. The ball swerved in just a touch but Rahul adjusted his foot movement to ensure he still had enough room to play the drive
stands tall and taps that short ball towards the off side, wanted the single, but Nair wasn't keen
gets half-forward and defends to short cover
angles a full ball on off from wide of the crease, Rahul check drives

cuts, and cuts well. This time it was off the frontfoot. A slap, if you can it. Picks the length early and gives it a thrash. The width was there and he picked the gap easily. Not even this slow outfield could prevent the ball from crossing the ropes.
length ball on middle, he nudges it between midwicket and mid-on for a quick single, Nair was off the blocks immediately
works it off his hip to midwicket
on the pads, Rahul, perhaps of the midwicket fielder, simply taps it to the on side instead of going for the flick
false shot, but gets away. Too full on the pads, but the ball swings away late, Rahul flicks, but the ball flies off the outside edge to third man
play and a miss. A bit of shape away from outside off, Nair prods forward to defend and is lucky that the ball moved as much as it did
walks down the pitch to negate the swing and eases the full ball to mid-off
floats a fuller delivery on off stump from wide of the crease, Rahul is firm as he defends from inside the crease
gently dabs that towards the fielder coming in from second slip, Nair is off the blocks in a jiffy to complete the run

sensible cricket, gets forward and bunts it to cover point to set off for a run, Chigumbura fires a wayward throw at the bowler's end to give away an overthrow as the man backing up couldn't stop the ball
full length delivery outside off from wide of the crease, left alone
tests the bounce of the surface by banging it in short on middle, Nair gets on top of the bounce and negotiates that one easily
no hurry whatsoever, this one had width outside off, but Nair is happy to let that go. It moved back in just a touch as well

check-drive, nearly carries to cover. The ball stopped on him a touch as Rahul went for the stroke, Raza diving to his left went with one hand, it wasn't far away from him. Full marks for the effort. The ball was dying on Raza, who saved a couple of runs there. Could have possibly gone with two hands? I'm not too sure. Anyway it was a split-second decision that he had to take.  Can't call it a drop
gets half-forward and defends to the off side
back of length delivery on middle, works it towards short midwicket for a quick single
full and straight on middle and off, good wrist work from Nair to play it to the left of midwicket, timed it well. Good balance too when he met the ball
shimmies down the pitch and plays the length ball on off stump with soft hands
shapes away just a touch, Nair gets on top of the bounce to ease it to the off side
tossed up on middle, driven with the spin to cover
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it to sweeper cover
drifts into middle and spins away a touch, Nair leans forward and plays it with the spin past cover
stretches forward to cover the line of the in-drifter and defends
driven with the spin to cover again, he's pushing them through here
gets half-forward and bunts it down to long-off
angles one full on off stump from wide of the crease, copy book forward defense from KL Rahul
turns it to midwicket, calls no immediately
looks to walk across but the bowler follows him to delivery a length ball on off stump, stabbed to the off side
another half-forward movement as Rahul plays it gently to cover
short of length on middle, bounces waist-high, Rahul is onto his toes as he bunts it back down the pitch
cuts and misses, lets out a cry of anguish. This didn't have the width Rahul would have liked, it kept a touch low as well. He missed as the ball went low to the keeper
good bounce for the ball well outside off, Nair lets it go easily
towards the leg side now and it deflects off the pads for a leg bye
back of length and coming in from well outside off, he defends it late to the off side
angling in way too much, Rahul works it off the pads behind square and comes back quickly for the second. That's the team fifty
straighter and fuller on off, pushed back to the bowler
back towards the leg stump and it's glanced to fine leg for one more. Rahul keeps strike
bit too full and with some room, Rahul drives it gently but with good timing through the covers and a side in the deep from Cremer saves one. The third umpire checks if it's clean and indeed it is
back of length and well outside off, Nair helps it to third man
room again, this time to Rahul and he punches it off the back foot between cover point and cover for two

he's dragged it on, Chibhabha gets a wicket! That short-of-length delivery looked like an offcutter after pitching outside off, and Rahul went after it without moving his feet. It came in, got the inside edge and struck the stumps
tempting line and length to drive outside off, but Rayudu leaves it alone
nips it in nicely with good bounce, Rayudu defends it back awkwardly
pretty short and angling in, Nair has some room to steer it to third man
not too close to the stumps, back of length and coming in, and Rayudu shoulders arms

much fuller and that's almost a gift to Rayudu to help him get off the mark. Full and just outside off, Rayudu didn't have to reach out for it and merely drove it down the ground, just past the bowler for four
room this time and he swishes at it with a cut to find the gap between cover point and point to find another boundary. Too much room and he pounced on it
better length outside off and he lets it go
even better - coming in from good length, Rayudu leans forward a bit and defends it late to short third man
presses forward for the length delivery and pushes it down
keeps a bit low outside off, Rayudu defends on the off side
touch closer to the stumps, Rayudu opens the face of the bat late to help it to third man
shuffles a bit to off and works the ball off the pads towards long leg for two
fullish towards off, pushed down to mid-on with a straight bat
presses forward, almost takes his top hand off while defending that
good line and length outside off, Rayudu defends it towards point
too much room and Rayudu slashes it straight to cover point
angling in sharply from wide of the crease, straight-bat defence from Rayudu
some room, but the ball nips in from back of length, Rayudu gets a bit of inside edge while trying to cut it away
works the ball from middle and leg to midwicket for one
almost drags it onto his stumps, but survives! The short ball came in, Nair stayed on the back foot to defend and the ball went off the bat to his pads, not far from the stumps
towards the pads and it's pushed down to mid-on
outside the off stump, Nair leans into it and defends solidly
uses his wrists to turn the ball from outside off to mid-on for one
good-length delivery outside off, he reaches out and drives gently into the covers
top-edged just over mid-on! Short ball and Rayudu pulls tentatively, he didn't go hard at it with firm hands, and the extra bounce got a top edge. Luckily for Rayudu, it went just over mid-on
outside the off stump now, pushed into the covers
fullish outside off, Rayudu drives it down to mid-off
covers the stumps and defends the straight ball back to the bowler
oh, what bounce! Short ball from wide of the crease, it didn't come in as much after pitching and Rayudu poked and nearly edged it to the keeper
coming into the batsman this time, he defends it down to mid-on
I don't know what he was trying but that's gone waaayyy down the leg side for five wides! It pitched nearly outside the pitch and the keeper tried, believe me
full and slightly wide outside off, driven nicely with a straight bat to sweeper cover
pitches on leg stump and it's gone down for another wide
not too far from off, Rayudu plants his back foot deep in the crease to cut but doesn't middle it
just short of length around off, Nair goes back and works it to midwicket where a dive saves at least one
nice and tight just outside off, Nair defends off the back foot
fullish on off, Nair flicks but can't clear midwicket. There's a direct hit at the umpire's end but he calls it a no-ball
short ball and he's pulled that away over mid-on for a one-bounce four! He was waiting to go for a bit hit, got a loose delivery and smashed it away
length delivery just outside off, defends by opening the face late to point
pretty straight on the off stump, he defends it from deep in the crease
just about back of length outside off, pushed into the covers
too full on the stumps and that's driven firmly down the ground to beat mid-on for four!
full again, this time on middle and leg, and it's flicked away with style between mid-on and midwicket this time for the same result. Hardly any reaction from the crowd
poor delivery down the leg side, the keeper got hands to it but it popped out and it's two wides
good comeback from Chigumbura - tight delivery outside off meets the straight bat
towards the pads now and it's flicked away to square leg for one
gets some room and Rayudu opens up his arms with a drive for one to bring up the team 100
shouts of "catch it"! The ball was angled in, Nair played it a bit early and the ball lobbed up towards mid-on but fell way short
almost edged to the keeper as he looked to defend the ball late, or maybe guide it to third man
touch wider outside off and this time it's left alone
bit too short and Rayudu rocks back to swat that wide of midwicket. In the gap and that's gone for four
much better - pretty straight on length and he defends it back
plants his front foot forward and blocks that length ball to cover
too wide and Rayudu gets another four - this time by cutting it nicely off the back foot. He had the room, he had the time and he did it in style
on off and turning away, it's defended back by Nair
mid-on is in and Nair dances down to reach the pitch of the ball and lofts it from the off stump to the long-on boundary for a one-bounce four
outside off now and it's cut after the turn to deep point for one
that's too short and Rayudu smashes it with a pull to the midwicket boundary for four more! That was a poor delivery and Rayudu has been pulling those with ease
length delivery now on off, pushed down to mid-on
beautiful delivery to end the over - teasing the batsman with the line and length just outside off, almost making him play as it turns away a bit
turning in a bit from outside off, pushed to the covers
more towards the stumps now and it's helped to leg for one
comes forward a bit but there's no room and he defends it to midwicket
on the front foot and it's pushed down to long-on easily
some more flight outside off, leans forward and drives to mid-off
shuffles a bit in the crease and defends it close to the pitch
pitched up outside off, driven with the turn to long-off
shorter around off, he goes back to cut it to point and he dives to save the run but then concedes an overthrow with a wayward throw
some flight outside off and it's driven down to long-off easily
too short and enough turn for Nair to cut it to sweeper cover for one
shuffles down (for the big shot?) but punches the ball through the covers
hardly any room and it's pushed into the covers again
comes down again but defends it back
the short ball makes him rock back in the crease but it turns a long way and takes him on the left pad
pushes this one with the turn to long-on for one

loud appeal for lbw and the umpire nods immediately! Raza roars as Nair walks back with disappointment. It was flighted nicely on the middle stump, pretty full, and Nair looked to sweep it, but missed it completely, hit right in front
he just needs one ball and that one is flighted way outside off, he drives by reaching out to it and hits the winning runs through the covers
